- Made with magicavoxel size 1500 x 1500

metadata.name: Los Osos 2422 #1647
metadata.description:
# Los Osos 2422

I was working on the next EmProps release when accidentally I opened a link to a bear utopic civilization through their existing metaverse. Or should I say "metabears"?

Enter Los Osos 2422. 

Four hundred years into the future bears live in a peaceful civilization heavily inspired by the generative art movement of our times. They are organized in districts that are sustained by bamboo, salmon, berries, and art! Los Osos are black, grizzly, panda, and polar, yet there are no distinctions between species; it's not like they were humans. 

They have different occupations but frequently bears change jobs giving birth to the most eclectic looks.

I took my sketchbook out to capture what I could and started drawing but my presence pissed them off. Ninjas, luchadores, and even a cybearpunk forced me to escape.  Is that a live gummy bear or am I just hungry? The story will continue...

-- 

Los Osos 2422 is a PFP art piece composed of 320 hand-made drawings made as an homage to the nascent generative art current fueled by Tezos blockchain technology in 2022. It features hundreds of references to artists and pieces in several generative and non-generative fields.

The project combines the assets together using a custom open-source algorithm that allows them to stack with the positioning in front and behind the character to create possibilities like shirt collars or hats, dynamic tinting to have hoodies or glasses with different colors, exceptions to give them laser eyes or a green apple in front of the face, complex set-ups to have different versions for some of the outfits, and chance control to allow precise control over the features.

--

Press 'S' on the keyboard to save it as an 1800 x 1800 pixels PNG.

metadata.name: Pixelnetika #29
metadata.description:
-------------------------------------------------

'drop it like it's raw'

-------------------------------------------------
Mouse-click switches between:
- screen scaled image
- The large image - with finer details

right-click: save/copy image

A custom created 'soft' pixel 2D/3D engine 
written in vanilla JavaScript
some more info in the source-code
The work will refresh and restart after some time
-------------------------------------------------

Pixelnetika - magnetic storms - Raw sketch 

-------------------------------------------------
Seen it in the past, whenever a group comes together.
Graffiti scene / Demo scene / Art scene etc. etc. 
New rules start popping up,
you should do this, you should do that..
Can't do this do this, you should not do that.
New rules, that can hinder you. 
If you start conforming/obeying the rules

Like seen people, making lovely works,
'but it should have more variations'
Adding all kinds of extras, 
that only made the work 
less powerful in the end

Or loosing themselves 
in the small details

Making 100 great and lovely sketches,
and finally releasing a work 
that totally did not work or sell at all.

Such a shame.


Well, it does not have enough variations

Variations: != 100 different extras?

For example, look at the Mark's Smoll-skulls or like Casey Reas works,
or like 100 warhol soup-cans, all just a littlebit different

I knew a classic composer, 
that really enjoyed creating works
when he was young.
Became a teacher,
conform within the institution
And lost all the joy he had for composing,
due to pressure and rules 'how things should be done'


Don't post too much

Some people like to work on 1 painting for years
trying to create their own Mona Lisa.

While Vincent van Gogh would paint lightning fast,
sometimes doing 1 painting a day


Break the rules
Make your own rules
set yourself free.
-------------------------------------------------

xxx Amsterdam chillout

For the love of Art, Polar bears, and throwing snowballs ^__^

August 12 2022

metadata.name: Dencity #333
metadata.description:
Dencity is a generative art project inspired by aerial views of cities with a high density of buildings. Its perspective effect, its perfectly imprecise lines, its subtle textures and its very advanced level of detail give it the appearance of a hand-drawn work.

Behind the visible art (the image) hides another form of art, an extremely complex algorithm capable of calculating and drawing in 2D each variation of the Dencity project. To draw a variation, the algorithm notably takes around 3,000,000 to 20,000,000 random decisions based on the hash of the mint and draws around 800,000 to 4,000,000 lines to create all the strokes and texture effects.

Made with ❤️, code and p5js.

metadata.name: Unendlichkeitsmaschine #237
metadata.description:
An exercise in infinity, recursion and transformation of form. A shape is drawn, sampled, transformed and repeated until the view of it is lost in infinity.

Made with p5js.

Double click to download
Add ?highres=true to the URL to get a higher resolution output

metadata.name: Herbarium #66
metadata.description:
"Herbarium" is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

Occasionally, I stumble upon vintage scientific illustrations on various topics, exotically looking charts and graphs, alternative layouts for the periodic tables or psychological research diagrams, elaborate illustrations of botany and zoology, minerals, and natural and sometimes unnatural phenomena. Most of those illustrations are part of the "art and science" practices from the 18th and 19th centuries. At the core of those practices were observation and interpretation, unraveling complexity through visualizing abstract ideas or finding a creative approach for understanding previously incomprehensible forms. 

I'm an admirer of two female pioneers in the field. Maria Sibylla Merian created, with immense dedication, a book with intricate illustrations of plants and insects, later praised by scientists. On the other hand, Anna Atkins published a book with beautiful botanical cyanotypes, considered the first book with photographic images. These topics are the visual inspiration for pieces presented at ArtBasel HK. 

My mathematical background makes me naturally attracted to graphs, converting numbers to curves, and everything schematically displayed. Also, combining scientific symbols and illustrations with imaginary data inspires the spectator to find meaning in unrelated or random things or provokes latent skepticism towards assumed concepts of truth, reality, and knowledge.

metadata.name: Moving White Lines #28
metadata.description:
Moving white lines that may or may not leave relaxing traces on your screen.

Press S to save a PNG
Press R to start recording a sequence of images
Press X to stop recording and download the zip


Made with p5js

metadata.name: Heat Death #689
metadata.description:
Heat Death is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at The Ever-Evolving World of Art, Art Basel Hong-Kong, 2022

It aims to produce variation and detail from minimal logic.

The source code uses p5.js and consists of around 180 lines of code. It has been left unminified for the interested viewer to learn more.

metadata.description: Shapes, colors and lines to create a composition with p5js.

metadata.name: Traveler #154
metadata.description:
Retro sci-fi style landscape sketch drawn by code.

Features:
- Terrain: Cliff, Cavern, Sky, Megalopolis, Desert, Sea, Space, Volcano
- Orientation: Landscape, Portlait
- Palette: White, Cream, Tan, Pink, Green, Yellow, Orange
- Background: Light, Dark

Live view options:
- Press "s" key: Saves the high resolution image (4200 x 3300 for landscape, 3300 x 4200 for portlait)

Depending on the device you run it on, it may take some time for the drawing to complete.
Made with p5js.

June 2022
ykxotkx

metadata.name: Choice #472
metadata.description: "You take the blue pill... the story ends, you wake up in your bed and believe whatever you want to believe. You take the red pill... you stay in Wonderland, and I show you how deep the rabbit hole goes"
